title: Stockholm Stock Exchange Building
text: The Stock Exchange Building () is a <a href="building">building</a> originally erected for the <a href="Stockholm%20Stock%20Exchange">Stockholm Stock Exchange</a> between 1773 and 1778 from construction drawings by <a href="Erik%20Palmstedt">Erik Palmstedt</a>. The stock exchange moved out of the building completely in 1998. It is located on the north side of the square <a href="Stortorget">Stortorget</a> in <a href="Gamla%20stan">Gamla stan</a>, the old town in central <a href="Stockholm">Stockholm</a>, <a href="Sweden">Sweden</a>, and owned by the city council. Since 1914 it has been the home of the <a href="Swedish%20Academy">Swedish Academy</a>, which uses the building for its meetings, such as those at which it selects and announces the name of the recipient of the <a href="Nobel%20Prize%20for%20Literature">Nobel Prize for Literature</a>. The building also houses the <a href="Nobel%20Museum">Nobel Museum</a> and the <a href="Nobel%20Library">Nobel Library</a>.
